tools

software and other tools we've found helpful
  • BizHawk (link) : for emulating console games. can read and modify the game state (ie, RAM) via Lua scripting
  • jsnes (link) : SNES emulator with somewhat easy integration with web browser stuff. mut's plunderludics uses this mainly
  • MAME (link) : another multi-purpose emulation framework
  • OBS (link) : useful for sending video from a game into another application
  • OSC (link) : nifty protocol that allows us to send messages between processes and computers to communicate game state easily
  • TouchDesigner (link) : node based real time video processing, allows us to do cool effects with video and test them in real time
  • VCV Rack (link) : for audio synthesis. can communicate with BizHawk via OSC.




plunderludics
